title: Define Project Scope and Requirements
description: Gather and document the detailed requirements for the BrainHealthMonitor system, including the types of neurological indicators to be tracked (e.g., cognitive function, sleep patterns, stress levels, physical activity, brain imaging data), data sources (e.g., wearable devices, user input, medical records, third-party data providers), target users (e.g., patients, healthcare providers, researchers, caregivers), and desired features (e.g., data visualization, alerts, recommendations, integration with electronic health records, data privacy and security measures, user authentication and authorization, scalability and performance considerations).

title: Design System Architecture
description: Develop the overall system architecture, including the components, data flow, and integration points.

title: Design Data Storage and Management
description: Design the data storage and management strategy, including the database schema, data ingestion pipelines, and data processing mechanisms.

title: Develop User Interface
description: Design and implement the user interface for the BrainHealthMonitor system, including data visualization and user interaction components.

title: Implement Backend Services
description: Develop the backend services for data processing, analysis, and integration with external systems.

title: Establish Security and Compliance
description: Define and implement security measures, data privacy protocols, and compliance with relevant regulations.

title: Set up Continuous Integration and Deployment
description: Establish a CI/CD pipeline for automated testing, building, and deployment of the BrainHealthMonitor system.

title: Create Documentation and User Guides
description: Develop comprehensive documentation, including technical specifications, user guides, and training materials.

title: Conduct Testing and Quality Assurance
description: Plan and execute thorough testing and quality assurance activities, including unit tests, integration tests, and user acceptance testing.
